{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3600933,"name":"zeta","username":"zeta","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T02:40:03.772Z","cooked":"

We’re looking to switch to Slack for communications and task management via the lists feature. We’d love to see or hear about:

  • Channel names and organization
  • Settings you changed from default
  • Unique bots, apps, or tools you use
  • Any rules or policies your team has that have been useful
  • How you train new users
  • How you handle members graduating
  • Any fun uses, emojis, or little sources of joy

Thanks for sharing!

Important to distinguish: are you on free plan or something else?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T02:42:55.922Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":292,"readers_count":291,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"zeta","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Aaron_Li","name":"RoboGeek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaron_li/{size}/10195_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30086,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Mentor"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600966,"name":"Vaani Mathur","username":"VaaniM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vaanim/{size}/170876_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T03:08:15.137Z","cooked":"

I can’t remember if this is different for pro or not, but if you’d like to have a dedicated announcements channel that only certain users can message in but everyone can read, this is only possible in the default General channel that a new Slack “server” comes with (it should give you an option in the channel settings). You won’t be able to do this with any other channel.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T03:08:15.137Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":280,"readers_count":279,"score":70.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"Vaani Mathur","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"zeta","name":"zeta","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/7feea3/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52896,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4639 | The RoboSpartans"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600976,"name":"evanperryg","username":"evanperryg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/evanperryg/{size}/259696_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T03:25:48.207Z","cooked":"

Encourage the use of public channels over DMs. This creates more open participation in conversations, and also makes it much easier to find information later.

Use replies. Shame people who don’t use replies.

Create channels for folks attending specific events, then archive those channels when the event ends.

Make it fun. Have channels where the kids just post memes. It’ll encourage them to actually install and use it.

Slack done wrong is organizational Amnesia. Slack done right is… tolerable. Between 1732 and my job, I have to tolerate Slack a lot.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T03:25:48.207Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":270,"readers_count":269,"score":298.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"evanperryg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20861,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1732 ← 3007 ← 2338"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601010,"name":"RoboGeek","username":"Aaron_Li","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaron_li/{size}/10195_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T04:24:32.858Z","cooked":"

  • Look into setting up user groups

    • Constraint: it’s tedious. You can only edit the groups on desktop, and there are UI “overrides” if channels are under the same section.
    • But it’s a really nice way to say @scouts or @cad and it pings all the people associated with it.

  • Guests (single channel guests can still DM on top of the one regular channel they see)

    • Useful if you want to collaborate with another team at an event but dont want to give full member access

General, Pro plan not required:

  • Notifications set up; this is not limited to just Slack. The killer of any potential communications platform is poorly defined notifications.
    • Learn how Slack’s notifications work
    • Teach it to members
    • Adjust your message styles so as to not abuse the notifications and risk people not getting any messages
","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T11:27:27.378Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":107.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"RoboGeek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"zeta","name":"zeta","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/7feea3/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":"Dunno why i typed awards","can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Seeking Knowledge; Failed Programming"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601016,"name":"Carolyn","username":"caro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/b19c9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T04:40:10.257Z","cooked":"

I made this 2-3 years ago and it’s probably due for an update since Slack Canvases and other features are now a thing but hopefully this helps you develop some communication guidelines for your team. As others here have suggested, we have channels for regionals that we archive after the events and we use groups as well.

I made this training doc for new team members. I’ll need to update it with some information about Canvases and Lists, but I have a little bit about it at the end of the slides

docs.google.com

Team - Intro to Slack

Intro to slack Novice Training

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T05:00:17.070Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":84.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"ahartnet","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/e/2PACX-1vTBALKqwQyT7laOVOUMSIynqmY7MY6LZcs-7D4wB6dMx4zsNpCCNvzp39Zf3k_l2CNzP1xLdy6DpDwI/pub?start=false&loop=false&delayms=3000","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Team - Intro to Slack - Google Slides","clicks":17}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15473,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5414 Mentor"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601267,"name":"joanne","username":"Jo_ESP","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/d26b3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T14:42:22.610Z","cooked":"

Some things we have found helpful:

  • limit abilities to “@everyone” (only give mentors, sponsors, captain, etc. access)
  • we have separate channels for programming, mech, etc. but we encourage everyone to keep up with them
  • separate channel to communicate shop schedule
  • private channels if needed
  • the only bot we use out of comps is billy the birthday bot, but we have nexus (queueing notif bot) for comps
","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T14:42:22.610Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":63.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"joanne","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/groups/everyone","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62602,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601322,"name":"Madhav Patel","username":"mpatel19","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mpatel19/{size}/201444_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T15:08:28.449Z","cooked":"
zeta:

Slack for communications and task management

Spectrum and Mechanical Advantage have good posts about this topic:
1.8 Intro to Spectrum Slack - Google Slides

FRC 6328 Mechanical Advantage 2025 Build Thread FRC Open Alliance
From Design to Delivery With an ultimate goal of maximizing our efficiency, we are committed to continuous improvement in our processes to enhance our flow and effectiveness. Over the offseason, we recognized the need for better organization in our parts handoff from CAD to fabrication, especially with an increasing number of students involved in the process. Previously, our parts handoff process was often chaotic, leading to miscommunication and delays. We faced significant challenges, includi…
","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T15:08:28.449Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":46.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"Madhav Patel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/e/2PACX-1vQtAhw-9TAAzyTfPaFHc_hoYwkKGsRiqa3oMHpqvIU2f0zEf6eH0Un58N8pJqmGHiAtDh1YuFvHppTS/pub?start=false&loop=false&delayms=3000&slide=id.p","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"1.8 Intro to Spectrum Slack - Google Slides","clicks":16},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/frc-6328-mechanical-advantage-2025-build-thread/477314/481","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC 6328 Mechanical Advantage 2025 Build Thread","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60925,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor FRC 1727 and 9072"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601448,"name":"Robertson Robotics","username":"s3529","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s3529/{size}/121055_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T16:16:35.778Z","cooked":"

My advice would be to take advantage of the “Lists”, as well as the “Canvas” “Automations” features. They’re surprisingly powerful and make for great organizational tools. Keeping track of our LEGO kits went from an agonizing spreadsheet to an easily searchable and filterable List, and we keep a Kanban style board to organize our outreach projects.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T16:16:35.778Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":45.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"Robertson Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24506,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601578,"name":"zeta","username":"zeta","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T17:41:09.486Z","cooked":"

That sounds really useful. Do you have specific examples you could share? Lists or automations.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T17:41:09.486Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500233,"topic_slug":"requesting-slack-tips-tricks-and-general-organization","display_username":"zeta","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"s3529","name":"Robertson Robotics","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s3529/{size}/121055_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30086,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Mentor"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601584,"name":"Robertson Robotics","username":"s3529","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s3529/{size}/121055_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T17:45:20.184Z","cooked":"

I would look at the “Deal Tracker” and the “Bug Tracker” templates that Slack provides. For automations, check out this as a good example: Slack lists: Collect and triage requests | Slack

Prefix your channels! Slack sorts all channels alphabetically, so group your channels by topic as “mech-climber”, “mech-intake”, etc.

evanperryg:

Make it fun. Have channels where the kids just post memes. It’ll encourage them to actually install and use it.

There are a lot of great tips in this thread that can help with efficiency and communication, but I’ll highlight this point: Making Slack fun is really important. When students are receiving upwards of 200 notifications per day across all of their other apps, it is really easy for team communication to get ignored or overlooked, and making Slack something they want to visit can go a long way.

One of the things we did was create a channel for students to post things that they do outside of the team. Originally it was just for “touching grass” (mental health stuff) but quickly became a way for students to post other extracurricular accomplishments, family celebrations, and basically anything else they participated in outside of the team, and helped kids and mentors on the team get to know each other. One student referred to it as “WildStang Instagram.”

Erictornabene:

One of the things we did was create a channel for students to post things that they do outside of the team.

This + funny stuff is what we are trying to turn our #random channel into

Other things we do:

  • No DMs except mentor → mentors or multiple mentors → student or student → multiple mentors. Admins don’t have access and I don’t want any Bad or Hidden Things to be happening in our slack server. I get sent the number of DMs every week and if it’s above normal I interrogate the mentor channel
  • Use reactions like read-receipts on “announcement” style posts
  • We definitely use custom emojis and I take emoji requests from the team members
  • My quest for the next year is to try to cut down on @everyone spam so there is less noise, but we let anyone use it (currently) since sometimes noone is by our door (wireless doorbell, someday…)

Here’s a smattering of our customs, featuring such bangers as “inspectorjosh”, “firmlygraspit”, “sadparty”, and “safety”/“unsafety”
